availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Nancy D. Robertson Utley. Father of Ann E. Utley, Margaret F. Utley, Jacob Utley, William Hawkins Utley, Benjamin F. Utley, and Susan E. Utley. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in 1850.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 350; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 540; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 120; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Smiths Mills, p. 6; Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates (1911-1955), Ancestry, 1925, Henderson County, Kentucky, file no. 26689.
